qas.question: Where was William Shakespeare's Othello set?
Where did British writer Lawrence Durrell reside from 1952-1956?
What book did Lawrence Durrell write while living on Cyprus?
Which 2014 novel uses Cyprus as its main location?

context: Examples of Cyprus in foreign literature, include the works of Shakespeare, with the majority of the play Othello by William Shakespeare set on the island of <a0_0>Cyprus<a0_0/>. British writer Lawrence Durrell lived in <a1_0>Cyprus<a1_0/> from 1952 until 1956, during his time working for the British colonial government on the island, and wrote the book <a2_0>Bitter Lemons<a2_0/> concerning his time in Cyprus which won the second Duff Cooper Prize in 1957. More recently British writer Victoria Hislop used Cyprus as the setting for her 2014 novel <a3_0>The Sunrise<a3_0/>.
